column4: i'm trying to install 32bit ff on my ubuntu 8.04 64bit (intel) install. i found a thread on the forums that does it for amd, would that also work for me? http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=1174435
why do you want to install 32bit firefox?
: i can't get a java applet to work but my friend running 32bit ubuntu can.
use those instructions.  Did you try using icedtea java plugin first though?
gcjwebplugin is an open one that is available on amd64
: http://paste.ubuntu.com/56112/ all it says, never opens anything
is this a dvd with css (some commercial movie)?
not really.  If other DVDs work, and this one works in XP all I can suggest is googling the error.  Can you pastebin the full output you are getting?
: i googled it and it seems all the problems are solved by using vlc but that won't work for me. how do i play the dvd using terminal?
mplayer dvd://  if you have mplayer
what command did you run?
: this is weird. my keyboard is literally typing on its own and random windows are opening up. haunted? lol
: mplayer dvd://media/cdrom0
nah, just 'mplayer dvd://'
: same output as before
it shouldn't be the same, pastebin
hmm, do you get a window if you specify a particular title.  Like with: mplayer dvd://1    (2,3,... etc)
: http://paste.ubuntu.com/56118/
: no i don't
yeah, your last pastebin tells us the real problem.  I don't know about it.  You have to scour for info on why dvdcss fails to crack some keys
: sudo: /usr/share/doc/libdvdread3/examples/install-css.sh: command not found
you said you had dvdcss already, so you don't need to run that
apt-cache policy libdvdcss2     confirms it is installed right?
:   Installed: 1.2.9-2medibuntu4
